page.title: 02INTRODUCING THE AREA
page.content: Lying at the west of the Blackmore Vale the land slopes from 500 ft. to 200 ft. above sea level.It is crossed by roads A357 Wincanton-Blandford and B3145 Wincanton-Sherborne.Also the now disused Bath to Bournemouth railway.Land is mainly used for milk,beef and sheep and some cor, potatoes,eggs and apples.Farmland costs up to Â£3000 per acre. Many farmworkers cottages have been modernised and are used as weekend retreats by city people especially in North Cheriton which is in a conservation area.Only Horsington has kept all village facilities.Most farms are run by families and few farmworker are employed.Young people have to find work in nearby towns.Some village events are held by Women's Institutes and churches for example harvest suppers and fetes.The area is unspoilt
